_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PANEL
name: Pelican Keeper
author: Leon@logocomp.com
description: Egg version of the Pelican Keeper Discord Bot.

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash

apt update
apt install -y curl unzip

mkdir -p /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server

set -euo pipefail

REPO="SirZeeno/Pelican-Keeper"

# The asset name we want (exact match, per your example)
ASSET_PATTERN="linux-x64.zip"

# Where to put extracted files
INSTALL_DIR="${INSTALL_DIR:-./}"

# Requirements
for cmd in curl unzip; do
  command -v "$cmd" >/dev/null 2>&1 || {
    echo "Error: '$cmd' is required but not installed." >&2
    exit 1
  }
done

tmpdir="$(mktemp -d)"
cleanup() { rm -rf "$tmpdir"; }
trap cleanup EXIT

# Extract the browser_download_url for the asset that ends with linux-x64.zip (no jq/python)
download_url=$(
  curl -fsSL "https://api.github.com/repos/$REPO/releases/latest" |
  grep -oE '"browser_download_url":\s*"[^"]+' |
  cut -d'"' -f4 |
  grep "$ASSET_PATTERN" |
  head -n 1
)

if [[ -z "${download_url:-}" ]]; then
  echo "Error: Could not find an asset ending with '${ASSET_NAME_SUFFIX}' in the latest release." >&2
  echo "Tip: Check the release assets and confirm the filename matches, e.g. Pelican-Keeper-vX.Y.Z-${ASSET_NAME_SUFFIX}" >&2
  exit 1
fi

zip_name="$(basename "$download_url")"
zip_path="${tmpdir}/${zip_name}"

echo "Downloading: $download_url"
curl -fL --retry 3 --retry-delay 1 -o "$zip_path" "$download_url"

echo "Extracting to: $INSTALL_DIR"
mkdir -p "$INSTALL_DIR"
unzip -o "$zip_path" -d "$INSTALL_DIR" >/dev/null

echo "Deleting zip: $zip_name"
rm -f "$zip_path"

## install end
echo "-----------------------------------------"
echo "Installation completed..."
echo "-----------------------------------------"

variables.name: Allow Server Startup
variables.description: UUIDs of servers that are allowed to be started up by users in the Discord server. (All if empty) (separated by a comma)

variables.name: Allow Server Stopping
variables.description: UUIDs of servers that are allowed to be stopped by users in the Discord server. (All if empty) (separated by a comma)

variables.name: Allow User Server Startup
variables.description: If Users in the Discord server are allowed to start servers in the list.

variables.name: Allow User Server Stopping
variables.description: If Users in the Discord server are allowed to stop servers in the list.

variables.name: Auto Update
variables.description: If you want the auto update to run on startup.

variables.name: Automatic Shutdown
variables.description: If you want to automatically shut down inactive servers.

variables.name: Continues Games To Monitor Read
variables.description: If the bot should read the Games To Monitor file continuously after startup. (Only once on startup if false)

variables.name: Continues Markdown Read
variables.description: If the bot should read the Markdown file continuously after startup. (Only once on startup if false)

variables.name: Debug
variables.description: If you want to see the full console output.

variables.name: Dry Run
variables.description: If you want to do a dry run.

variables.name: Empty Server Timeout
variables.description: The time a server can be empty until it gets shut down. (Format Example: Days:Hours:Minutes)

variables.name: Ignore Internal Servers
variables.description: Don't display any servers whose IP matches the internal IP structure.

variables.name: Ignore Offline Servers
variables.description: Don't display Offline Servers.

variables.name: Internal IP Structure
variables.description: IP Structure in the local Network Pelican is sitting in.

variables.name: Joinable IP Display
variables.description: If the Joinable IP of the servers should be displayed.

variables.name: Limit Server Count
variables.description: If you want to limit the server count in the list to a specific number.

variables.name: Markdown Update Interval
variables.description: Time in seconds after which the bot reads the Markdown file again. (Can't go below 10 seconds)

variables.name: Max Server Count
variables.description: The maximum number of servers you want to be in the server list.

variables.name: Message Format
variables.description: The Message format you want the bot's output Message to be.

variables.name: Message Sorting
variables.description: How the bot should sort the Servers in the list.

variables.name: Message Sorting Direction
variables.description: The direction the Bot should sort the Servers in the list.

variables.name: Output Mode
variables.description: The Output category you want the bot's output to display.

variables.name: Player Count Display
variables.description: If the Player Count of the servers should be displayed. (Only works with supported Games)

variables.name: Server Update Interval
variables.description: Time in seconds after which the bot fetches the new information from Pelican. (Can't go below 10 seconds)

variables.name: Servers To Auto Shutdown
variables.description: UUIDs of the servers you want the automatic shutdown to apply to. (All if empty) (separated by a comma)

variables.name: Servers To Display
variables.description: UUIDs of the servers you want to be displayed in the list. (All if empty) (separated by a comma)

variables.name: Servers To Ignore
variables.description: UUIDs of servers you want to exclude from the server list. (None if empty) (separated by a comma)

variables.name: Servers To Monitor
variables.description: UUIDs of the servers for which you want the player count to be displayed. (All if empty) (separated by a comma)

variables.name: Users Allowed To Start Servers
variables.description: USERID of the users who are allowed to start servers in the Discord server. (All if empty) (separated by a comma)

variables.name: Users Allowed To Stop Servers
variables.description: USERID of the users who are allowed to stop servers in the Discord server. (All if empty) (separated by a comma)
